text: (upbeat music)

- Welcome to our
introductory training session on digitization for SMBs.

In this session today, we'll
be taking a closer look at how technology can empower SMBs

to meet their growth aspirations and how "AWS" can support you
along your digital journey.

My name is Naveen. I am the national business
development leader for "AWS Training and Certification"

and I'm part of "Amazon Internet
Services Private Limited" in India. So, let's dive right into
the agenda for today.

In today's session, we will
cover three main topics. Why digitization is critical
for you to grow faster
in an ever-changing business environment? What are the challenges associated with adopting digital technologies

and how can you overcome these challenges? And lastly, but surely not the least, how to take your first
step in digitization

and where "AWS" can help you? Our first (indistinct) of the day, is understanding why
digitization is critical
for you to grow faster in an ever-changing business environment. For all SMBs,

regardless of where you may
be on your digital journey, digitization allows you to grow faster,

primarily through three main mechanisms. One, digitization allows you
to expand your reach,

creating connections to
new customers and markets, quickly and seamlessly and allowing you to
address new opportunity.
Two, digitization allows you to simplify operations and processes, eliminating operation inefficiencies
and allowing you to focus your energy on growth-related activities.

And lastly, digitization allows you to
implement advanced capabilities
that had previously been the sole reserve of larger corporations, allowing you to (indistinct) your weight

and compete on a more level-playing field. Firstly, when it comes
to expanding your reach,

digitization allows you
to do this in two ways. It lets you to broaden
your presence across India.

With consumers increasingly
preferring to shop online, having an online retail presence,

that is, on e-commerce platforms
or social media platforms, allows you to gain access
to a larger local market.

With 80% of new shoppers
coming from tier-two cities and smaller towns and 95% of all pin codes in India,

now being accessible to e-commerce, it has never been easier to
have an all-India presence

for your business. Digitization can help
you overcome this notion that your market in India is defined

by proximity or language. In addition, digitization can help you
expand beyond your core market

and allow you to reach and
serve customers beyond India. 86% of SMBs reported an increase
in cross-border business

during COVID 19. In particular, Indian retail
SMBs on e-commerce platforms,

were able to export product
to 42 countries on average, highlighting how e-commerce platform,

can easily allow customers
from all over the world to view and purchase your offerings,
while managing the delivery operations, to relieve some of the burden, associated with global logistics.

Many SMBs, like yours, have
leveraged online selling on e-commerce platforms,
such as "amazon.in"

to reach existing and
prospective customers to grow their revenue. Here are some successful examples.

Zafar Nisar from "DELTA
Leather Corporation" said this. "In three years,

demand for our products has
grown from three to four times."

Parisha Agarwal Goenka
from "SVA Organics" says, "In just 2.5 years,

our business has grown by 300 times." Dheepakh Rajaram from
"Goodness - Amazon" says,
"Within months, I'm earning 5 lakhs monthly revenue and had reached 200% revenue growth."

Let's watch a video to
understand Dheepakh's story in detail. (uplifting music)
- People can be good, sometimes bad. But dogs, dogs can only be good.
(uplifting music) That's why they say all dogs go to heaven. (uplifting music) My name is Dheepakh Rajaram.

I'm the founder of "Goodness" pet food, a family-based company, where we are committed towards
fresh and natural ingredients

for dogs. When I was a child, I had
this dog named "Fluffy". She was a white German Shepherd

and I lost this dog when
I was eleven years old. (uplifting music) Four years ago,

I wanted to reconnect this
relationship with the dogs and that's when Elsa and
Velvet came into my life.
I started loving them, taking good care of them and feeding them. And that's where I found out

that a lot of things missing in dog food, because they started giving a
lot of allergies toward this.
And after a long research, I found out what I was giving my dogs, was not the best food for them.
And that's when this urging feeling, created a passion to myself

and I contacted a lot of
manufacturers in the world and one of them started supplying me

with a super product with
full of goodness in it. And that's when I launched "Goodness".
After we launched "Goodness", retail part was not working for us. Because there was a lot of lack

in nutrition awareness in India. Many retailers didn't want
to work with a new brand.

So, we had listed our
products in "Amazon", because "Amazon" is a
globally known platform.

And in the first month, it gave me a revenue
of just 10,000 rupees,

but it made me smile. And I was very happy about
that, what "Amazon" did for me.
And just within two and half years, my sales got increased to high 5 lakhs and in the past seven months,
my sale got increased to 200%. (uplifting music) And throughout this journey,

there was one person stood by
my side and that was my wife. (uplifting music)

- I know him for the past twelve years and we have been married
for the past six years and now, we have three
kids, my son, Rushal

and two more kids, who
are Elsa and Velvet. And now, I'm being a part of this business and taking care of the order
management, stocks and FBA.

- And also, we are on "Prime" actually, so that we can reach our
customers as fast as we can. (uplifting music)

"Goodness" never compromises
on quality and nutrition and I'm just glad that thousands of dog lovers
has experienced "Goodness"
through "Amazon". (uplifting music)
- Digitization also enables you to streamline backend processes that may tie up too much of your time,

freeing your team to focus on
growth-related opportunities. For example, many SMBs complain that one
of the biggest drawbacks

of offering e-commerce services, is dealing with returns as
shown in this quote here.

Having a comprehensive
written policy is important in order to build trust
with online shoppers

and drive repeat visits. However, managing large
volumes of returns,

imposes additional cost on retailers, as they have to not only
process the returns,

they will, then, have
to inspect their item, re-list it on their inventory, refresh their stock levels

and also, process the
refund to the customer. These activities take a valuable time

for retailers fulfillment teams, who are already having to
deal with large (indistinct).

Digital solutions, like
inventory management systems, can help deal with these problems, arriving from returns,

by streamlining the
returns management process, helping you organize and
restock return products quickly
to minimize the cost of handling returns and process refunds to customers quicker

to improve customer satisfaction. Some SMBs also cite the
amount of effort it takes

to find and engage online shoppers and the fact that they
don't know how to do this

in a systematic fashion as
seen in this quote here. Effective (indistinct) is the lifeblood

of any business. However, when transitioning
to online business, many SMBs find that the
(indistinct) tactics

that work for them in the offline space, for example, cold-calling,
billboards, et cetera,

doesn't naturally translate
to the digital realm. An entirely new approach is needed
to attract customers online, particularly, as customers continue to spend more time on digital media.

SMBs struggle to implement the right type of (indistinct), prospecting
and marketing tactics

that would allow them to successfully engage customers online as they are either
unaware of how to do this,

or are unable to hire
sufficient number of employees with the right skill sets to drive this.

Digital solutions like
automated lead generation, prospecting and marketing tools,

help to lead and automate the process of lead generation and
customer engagement, so that your team can
immediately roll out,

proven online marketing tactics, while ensuring that
your team will not need to spend as much time manually,
driving these activities.

Many SMBs find it hard to keep
track of the many payments that they are owed by the vendors

and chasing after these payments, take an inordinate amount of
time as seen in this quote.

Allow customers to make purchase on credit or offering them to
make deferred payments, in case, 30 days or 60 days payment term,

is a necessary component of building strong
relationship with vendors and maintaining transactional ease.

Yet, managing receivables is important as delays in payment can
cause cash flow shortages

for the SMB and may lead to
more serious financial issues. Many SMBs manage their
receivables manually,

which makes it hard to implement easy, consistent
communication with vendors,

so that they know what
is owed, when it is due and how to submit payment.

Digital solutions like e-invoicing tools, can help automate the process of tracking and sending
payment reminders to vendors

and ensure that SMBs are
on top of their payments to reduce the amount of man-hours spent,

chasing down receivables, while maintaining clear and
consistent communications with the vendors.

Particularly, in the hybrid working area, many SMBs find it hard
to monitor their staff

to ensure that they are
where they need to be, in order to serve customers,
as seen in this quote.

Tracking employee attendance
in the workplace is important as it gives an accurate
picture of labor cost,

ensures that employees are present and allows companies to make
better scheduling decisions.

However, manually verifying, that your employees are
where they need to be, takes up inordinate
amount of managers' time

and maybe, subject to
inaccuracies and fraud. Digital solutions like
attendance tracking tools,

can help automate the process of marking attendance
through submission of photos and location tags,

allowing managers to easily
verify employee attendance, reducing the amount of time
and effort spent on ensuring attendance. Another oft-repeated complaint,

is that SMBs find it difficult
to track their expenses, due to the many expenses
that they have to engage

in every day. According to a study by (indistinct), organizations spend an
average of 45 minute,

per expense report when
the process is manual. With an expense tracking solution,

businesses can reduce their
expense processing cost by 60%, which saves about $7 per expense report

and shorten their
expense reporting process to a few minutes. Not only do SMBs have to devote resources

to manually input data from receipts, they have to check if these expense violate
established policies

and follow up with employees
to justify spending, activities that can
take a fair bit of time.

Expense tracking solutions, can help SMBs automatically
extract data from receipt

and import it as expense
entries to accounting systems, while checking compliance with
established expense policies

and allowing SMBs to analyze
their expenditure pattern, easily. With the rapidly changing
business environment

and growing number of competitors, it is even more important
for SMBs to be agile

in adapting and reacting
to the changing landscape. Digitization is critical
for SMBs like yours

to accelerate your growth in a rapidly changing
business environment. Technology enables you to
streamline your operations
as you grow, such as, automating your backend processes that take up too much time,

freeing your team to focus on
growth-related opportunities. Let's hear from our SMB community.

This is Ankush Aggarwal, CEO and founder of "DukanDwar",
an electronics e-commerce.

Ankush has been using
SMB-focused technology solutions, under "Amazon Digital Suite"
to run his business operations

and this is what he said. "'Amazon Digital Suite'
has helped us scale

and it plays an integral
part of our growth story. It has helped us reduce
our cost by almost 70%

and their after-sales
support was exceptional. We were able to manage all our 'Amazon
Digital Suite' products
and billings from a single dashboard." Lastly, in this section, we also mentioned as the third mechanism

that modernized capabilities
can help SMBs cope with some of these scenarios and here's how.

"It's the eve of Diwali with
high traffic on your website, but excessive lag make
customers leave your site,
before purchasing anything." Hosting your website on the "Cloud", can help you manage unexpected spikes
in (indistinct) traffic, while ensuring high levels of availability and customer experience.

Next one. "Tax season is fast approaching, but your physical
computers have been stolen
and you lose all your records, receipts and critical documents."
Cloud-based data backups can ensure that sensitive data is saved and can be retrieved easily,

while also ensuring privacy controls with only authorized users, being able to access
certain categories of data.

Let's look at another scenario. "With your salespeople working from home, their inability to easily
access key customer information,
leads to a drop in sales performance." Migrating critical business applications,

like CRM, ERP and HRMS to the "Cloud", can ensure that all
users working remotely,
can securely access critical information from across the organization

that may need to perform
key tasks like sales. Let's take another scenario.
"You anticipate higher demand for your manufactured good this year, but you don't know how much to produce
and end up over-producing." Analytical capabilities like forecasting,

can help solve complicated
optimization problems without requiring,

having to hire out a
specialized forecasting and data analytics team.
Moving on. "Customers try to contact you for support, but your staff is too busy

to attend to their calls promptly, leading to lower customer
satisfaction levels."

Digital tools like chatbox, can help you provide a
better customer experience by allowing you to engage
with customers 24/7,
routing simple requests, for example, delivery status inquiries to automated channels,

while escalating more serious
issues to human operators, helping to deploy human intervention,
where it is most required. Before we end this session, let's hear from our SMB community

about how they leverage
modernized capabilities affordably to differentiate their business.

This is Aryaman Thakker, the
director of "Group Landmark", a company who has been using
"Cloud" services from "AWS".

Aryaman said, "Many of our business
applications have achieved speed and provided us with flexibility

to collaborate with multiple partners." To sum up in this section, we have covered how
digitization allows you

to reach existing and prospective
customers more easily, within India and across the board.

We have also taken a look at
how digitization allows you to streamline your operations,

helping your resolve a range of issues from inventory management,
to expense tracking,

through greater
simplification and automation. We have examined how certain modernized
capabilities can help you cope

with five common scenarios
to optimize your operations and craft a better user
experience for your customers.

And lastly, through these avenues,
we have demonstrated how digitization can ultimately enable you

to accelerate your growth. We'll now move on to the second
main topic in our agenda.
What are the challenges associated with adopting digital technologies and how can you overcome these challenges?

Some of you here, maybe
facing some challenges when adopting technology, such as lack of knowledge and skills

to use use that technology
or a lack of support. In fact, we did a recent
study with over 3000 SMBs

to answer this question. And from the study, we found
that the four key challenges
that SMBs are facing today, when it comes to adopting technology, are, one, lack simplicity,
two, lack affordability, three, lack accessibility

and four, lack of support. Now, let's dive right
into each one of them.

Firstly, lack simplicity. Many existing solutions are
not particularly user-friendly.

There are too many solutions in the market for you to easily select
the correct solution, or a set of solutions,
appropriate for your needs.

As evidenced by this quote. "SMBs want solutions that
are built from the ground-up,

focusing on SMB needs in
terms of easy implementation and simplified interfaces."

Secondly, lack affordability. "Most current technology
offerings have high upfront costs

and require a long term commitment, without granting you the flexibility to switch between plans if
your requirements change.

Furthermore, it is hard to
justify a high price tag, when you are uncertain
about the value these solutions offer." As seen in this quote, the value of many offerings,

are not really apparent to SMBs, particularly, when the
upfront costs are unaffordable

for them. Thirdly, lack accessibility. "Many SMBs are unaware
of marketplaces or stores

is not always straightforward, with multiple rounds of
evolution and presales,
before they can actually start purchasing and using the solution." As evidenced in this quote,

many SMBs are not even aware
of where they can turn to, in order to find the

Finally, lack of support. "Many SMBs also find that the
type of support and guidance

that they receive for
solutions they purchase, is too limited and is not pitched at a
level for them to understand,

given their lack of familiarity with the technical

For example, point of sales,

horizontal technology need,
